author: Stanzilla
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Currently, when the CWD is a UNC path, it is displayed like so

`PS Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\FileSystem::\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\stan\projects\personal\yarntest>`

Would it be possible to display it as a normal path instead? like so

`PS \\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\stan\projects\personal\yarntest>`

Or is that something my profile broke?

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

<!-- 
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
Consider providing an example PowerShell experience with expected result.
-->

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Not sure how complex this would be to make behave as you expect, but you can always use the `New-PSDrive` cmdlet to add a simpler address to the path, e.g.:

```ps1
New-PSDrive -Provider FileSystem -Root \\wsl$\Ubuntu\ -Name WSL

Set-Location WSL:\home
```

comments.author: Stanzilla
comments.body: Well my request was mostly to improve the default since it does look a bit "wrong".

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
WSLUser
comments.body: Ran into this when starting PSCore from my wsl2 instance. The result was ugly and unusable to say the least. In an non-maximized instance of Windows Terminal, the path consumes most of the space, especially if opened several directories deep into the wsl user profile. There's no space left on the line for a full word in that case. Instead it should show as `PS \\wsl$\distroname\home\username\whatever` (and consolidate to `...` for really long paths showing only the last 2 linux directories)

comments.author: Stanzilla
comments.body: No worries, @thlac is working on a fix already.

title: [Feature Request] Better display of UNC paths
